intro: Schwenckia fasciculata, commonly known as the common schwenckia, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Schwenckia fasciculata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and can thrive in well-drained soil with full sun.
